description: From mero- (“partial”) +‎ Ancient Greek κρῑ́νω (krī́nō, “to separate”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy, biology, histology) Of or pertaining to certain exocrine glands that secrete without major damage to the secretory cells.
examples: Merocrine cells have several full secretion cycles — the merocrine secretion cell does not die when it secretes into the lumen of the gland.
